citations.narrative:
Some of the disposition records listed the city of where animals were sold but didn't have address of where animals were
sold. Having name and address on records of disposition is required and can be important for animal health tracing.
Ensure that name and address are fully disclosed on animal disposition records.
***To be corrected from 3/3/2025 forward.

Two enclosures had plastic perches that had become partly detached and so the leaning perch didn't provide enough
perching space for all birds in the enclosure. Also, another enclosure with 4 pineapple connures had one perch and one of
the three connures was seen to be pushed away from the single perch more than once during inspection. Inadequate
perching space for each bird in an enclosure doesn't ensure each bird can rest comfortably. For perching bird species
such as parakeets and connures, there must be an adequate amount of perching space so that each bird can freely
choose to perch.
***Correct by 3/5/2025.

An enclosure housing three pineapple (painted) conures has a perch that all sit on, however it was seen they could not sit
fully upright without their heads touching the top of the enclosure and had minimal space to stretch their wings out without
bumping into each other. While their plumage appeared normal and they could go to the floor to stand fully upright,
perching fully upright and the ability to spread wings are normal postural positions that an enclosure must provide space
for. Ensure that conures are housed in a larger enclosure that provides for normal postural adjustments.
***Correct by 3/4/2025.
The facility has not had space requirements for painted conures formally reviewed and approved by the attending
veterinarian (AV) as they have for other species. Ensuring that the space requirements for each bird species is reviewed
by the AV is required and helps ensure birds and group of birds have adequate space for health and comfort. Ensure to
consult with the AV for the conures' space.
***Correct by 3/10/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the animal caretaker.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)(iv) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Some of the disposition records listed the city of where animals were sold but didn't have address of where animals were 
sold. Having name and address on records of disposition is required and can be important for animal health tracing. 
Ensure that name and address are fully disclosed on animal disposition records.  
***To be corrected from 3/3/2025 forward. 
3.153(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two enclosures had plastic perches that had become partly detached and so the leaning perch didn't provide enough 
perching space for all birds in the enclosure. Also, another enclosure with 4 pineapple connures had one perch and one of 
the three connures was seen to be pushed away from the single perch more than once during inspection. Inadequate 
perching space for each bird in an enclosure doesn't ensure each bird can rest comfortably. For perching bird species 
such as parakeets and connures, there must be an adequate amount of perching space so that each bird can freely 
choose to perch.  
***Correct by 3/5/2025. 
3.153(b) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
An enclosure housing three pineapple (painted) conures has a perch that all sit on, however it was seen they could not sit 
fully upright without their heads touching the top of the enclosure and had minimal space to stretch their wings out without 
bumping into each other. While their plumage appeared normal and they could go to the floor to stand fully upright, 
perching fully upright and the ability to spread wings are normal postural positions that an enclosure must provide space 
for. Ensure that conures are housed in a larger enclosure that provides for normal postural adjustments.  
***Correct by 3/4/2025. 
 
The facility has not had space requirements for painted conures formally reviewed and approved by the attending 
veterinarian (AV) as they have for other species. Ensuring that the space requirements for each bird species is reviewed 
by the AV is required and helps ensure birds and group of birds have adequate space for health and comfort. Ensure to

consult with the AV for the conures' space.  
***Correct by 3/10/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the animal caretaker.

species.common: BARBARY DOVE / RINGED TURTLE-DOVE / RINGNECK DOVE
